reviews.text: From the lovely front desk staff welcome , right down to the plush bath towels in your room and the Riedel glassware this is the best place to stay in Osoyoos. It is a beautiful new property, the rooms are lovely , spacious, the kitchen is well appointed with Royal Doulton china, the balconies have beautiful patio furniture. The staff are friendly and helpful . The pool and waterslide are awesome.The wine bar has a selection of local wines and small plates. 5 stars!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had every amenity you could ever need. Cleanliness was impecable, staff were extremely friendly and the entire atmosphere was very relaxed.
reviews.title: Everything you could ask for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Watermark the weekend before the May long weekend. Though the town and the hotel were not busy at all it made our stay that much more memorable. We have always stayed in Kelowna but after staying in Osoyoos we will always stay here in our future trips out to the Okanagan. This hotel is conveniently located next to a great restaurant called Breeze and walking distance to a nice little deli called Dolci Deli...(make sure you have thier "black bread"). As well there is a Super value right next door to the Watermark which came in so handy as we bought our grocery the day after we got there and were able to bar BQ right out on the patio. ( Amazing BarBQ by the way) Everything to do with the Watermark Beach Resort was fantastic and would recommend this property to anyone thinking of getting away for a day / weekend / month whatever. We loved our stay and are anxtiosly counting down the days till we return.
reviews.title: Oasis in Osoyoos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited Osoyoos many times over the years and always hoped someone would open a really first class hotel. Well it now has happened. The Watermark, right on the lake, is a lovely new hotel with beautifully appointed rooms, great service, and excellent food. If you are wanting to stay at the best hotel on Osoyoos, this is it. Prices are very reasonable.
reviews.title: Beautiful new hotel in Osoyoos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wfe and I spent our 32nd wedding anniversry here last week-end.
reviews.title: Beautiful Memory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I often wondered about the reviewers who had nothing good to say. I now think I have figured it out. . . While many things can go right, it is the one BIG thing that can either ruin your stay or color your impression of everything else.
reviews.title: This place has some kinks to work out. . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a 5 hour drive we arrived for our lakeside room on a weekday at around 4:30 (check in was 4:00) and was sent to a room (#117) that was on the first floor at the back of the building looking out onto a parking lot and some dumpsters. We figured we must have been sent to the wrong room yet when we called the front desk who was essentially indifferent and uninformed all we got is "that is a lakeside room in my computer." I guess it was if you went outside, went around a huge post and then, maybe you got a little sliver view of the lake. When we diplomatically asked if we could be moved, the casual response was "nothing was ready and it would take 1-2 hours for someone to clean another room". So out we go to try and while away a couple of hours; they also said they would move our bags to the second room and to leave them in the first.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Resort and Wonderful Staff!
I wish I could agree with all positive reviews, but I don't
reviews.text: Two hours later we are back and given keys to a new "lakeside" room (#111) - - which wasn't. It was on the first floor, behind the pool with no view unless, again, you went outside around the pool and went in search of the lake. Again, despite obvious signs that the hotel was even 1/2 full, we were told there were no clean rooms and they would attempt to move us the next day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did get moved by about 5:00 the next day. Our bags never did make it from room to room until we requested it (twice, in both cases.)
reviews.title: Recent Trip - Osoyoos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are reasonable people so want to give a balanced review for the Watermark. The hotel is in a nice location and the (real) lakeside rooms are lovely. New, clean, nicely appointed, etc. Our recommendations are simple:
reviews.title: The Best Place I've stayed in Okanagan ...

reviews.text: I depended on the website to choose a place to stay for a 'girl friends' weekend. I felt misled by the promise of a mountain view which in fact means on the highway which is part of the main drag of Osoyoos. The balconies at the back would be unusable because of traffic noice and dust. Luckily we could change to the front and from the ground floor walk right into the pool or lake. The price however was staggering even for 3 professionals. No wonder the place was not full on a beautiful summer weekend.
reviews.title: Watermark Beach needs to pay attention to service and value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities that were promised for the Spring of 2011 are not yet available, e.g. spa, water sports equipment. Service was very amateur, e.g. no help with baggage when we changed rooms, our keys did not work and we had to go back 3 times to get fixed with no apology let alone interest from the too few young staff on duty.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort Beautiful location

reviews.text: Restaurant was below average and hallway outside of kitchen smelled of reused grease.
reviews.title: Amazing resort in an unbelievable location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently had a wonderful weekend get away to Watermark Beach Resort. What a beautiful resort on a beautiful lake in a beautiful part of BC. The resort is brand new and top notch. The rooms are first class, the pool is great and the kids love the waterslide. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to make you feel at home. If your into wine or golf this is the destination for you. My wife and I spent a day touring some of the fantastick wineries all with 20 minutes of the resort...what a wonderful way to spend the day!!! then back to the resort for a swim and dinner. I would recommend this resort to all my friends and family
reviews.title: Local Oasis with all the Amenities

reviews.text: This was technically a business trip, but we couldn't help but feel like we were on vacation the whole time. If you've never been to Osoyoos, you must very soon! It's consistently the hottest place in Canada, hidden in a beautiful desert valley packed with wineries and orchards. The best place to stay there is the Watermark, located right on the lake. Super-fun pool and waterslide only about 20 steps away from the beach...take your pick. Very family-friendly! The comfy rooms all have balconies with great views of the surrounding hills and lake and most have full kitchens. Spectacular!
reviews.title: beautiful resort but still has some opening growing pains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first stay at Osoyoo's newest resort and all in all a good experience. Pro - great room - we had a 1 bedroom suite which was very nicely appointed and a very very comfortable bed. A really nice patio and wine bar. Location is tough to beat and the whole place says quality. They are still working out a few kinks in terms of staffing ie the service on the patio was very slow but its a lovely location if you have to sit and wait. I was also impressed with the maintenance staff - attentive and experienced. The only real downside I can say is that this resort really works for families with small children but if you don't have any, you are hard pressed to find a quiet corner anywhere in the pool area. Also, no poolside service for drinks which must really reduce yield. The Cove up the lake made more money from us last year just for that reason. Lovely resort though and a great addition to Osoyoos.
reviews.title: Family Fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Watermark based on how pet friendly it sounded - we travelled with our six month old puppy and stayed July 22-25.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Watermark, had pros and cons

reviews.text: Before we had left, I had emailed the resort to let them know we would be travelling with our dog and mentioned that we may use doggy daycare - Lindsey from the resort emailed us back right away and let us know of a new place that had just opened up, and they sent someone to go check out the facilities and get business cards. I thought this was above and beyond and really appreciated the effort put in.
reviews.title: Yes, we would go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first arrived, we were given a 'doggy package' which included all the pet information we could want, the business card to Doggy Daycare and bylaw information.
reviews.title: What a wonderful relaxing anniversary!

reviews.text: We were given an upgrade to a 2 bdrm ground floor suite, which was so kind of them, since the ground floor was more suitable for a pet - however, the view was straight onto the pool and when we first arrived it was SO noisy - you also looked onto the common bbq area and were about 10 steps from the hottub - this location would be fantastic for anyone with kids who would be using the pool a lot, unfortunately it wasn't the spectacular lake view we were looking for and we're not huge fans of noisy children.
reviews.title: Nice rooms but beach area is not as advertised
